p: The use of AI is prevalent in drug discovery, and many pharmaceutical corporations have established in-house partnerships or initiatives with AI companies. Some organizations are currently using AI approaches to find novel uses for late-stage drug candidates or repurpose existing drugs [ 34, 35]. However, data of sufficient quality are needed to train systems for COVID-19 AI implementation. Data accessibility is an additional challenge because the systems will be trained via supervised learning, which requires substantial amounts of data on COVID-19 to accurately perform complex tasks.
